title.rendered: Financial Commission Announces Participation in Upcoming Barcelona Trading Conference (BTC)

content.rendered:
April 3rd, 2019, The Financial Commission today announces its participation in the 1st annual Barcelona Trading Conference, which will take place July 11-12th at the Barcelona International Convention Center in Spain.

The event, which was created to celebrate and explore the potential of digital assets, will bring together +3,500 attendees, +120 exhibitors and +100 speakers, uniting the biggest names in the crypto community.

 

The Financial Commission will host a dedicated booth to highlights its efforts in the Blockchain and digital asset space. Specifically, the organization will provide attendees with information on dispute resolution services and self-regulatory efforts recently launched through the Blockchain Association. All attendees are invited to review our membership proposal and case examples of free Blockchain dispute resolutions in practice.

We invite all interested parties to meet us at the BTC! Stay tuned for further updates!

About Financial Commission

Founded in 2013, the Financial Commission is a leading independent member-driven external dispute resolution (EDR) organization for international online brokerages that participate in global foreign exchange (forex), derivatives, and CFD markets.

Financial Commission provides efficient compliance solutions to its members, alongside its External Dispute Resolution (EDR) mechanism that serves as an effective channel for processing complaints from clients of member firms.

To find out how the Commission is expanding efforts into self-regulation and transparency for the digital currencies and Blockchain markets, please visit the Blockchain Association page of our website.
